Description: A woman's shawl, embroidered on a red ground, with fringing. Ground made of dark red twill woven wool cloth (commercially made). Deep embroidered pattern on two of four sides. A line of identical pink and white flowers and foliage, framed within arches on the inner side and a wavy line on the outer side. The outer patterning itself contains a swag of daisy-like flowers and foliage. The centre field has eight rows of a single repeating, pale yellow floral motif. All embroidery is worked in floss silk yarns. Each edge is turned and machine stitched, with applied knotted maroon silk fringing, worked in a diamond pattern. Two sections of fringing damaged; small holes in cloth; one patch. Blue dye (from another garment?), in parts of centre field.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Shelagh Weir (BM Ethnography Department staff)
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Palestine (Historic), Jaffa (Yaffa) (luggage label with object)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989-1991, London, Museum of Mankind, 'Palestinian Costume'
